title-group.article-title: Dante in Paradise: The End of Allegorical Interpretation

ref.mixed-citation: Dante Alighieri, The Divine Comedy. Paradiso 1: Italian Text and Translation, tr. Charles S. Singleton (Princeton, 1975), Paradiso XXXIII, line 131, p. 378; hereafter cited in text as DC, by line number.
Samuel Taylor Coleridge, The Statesman's Manual, ed. W. G. T. Shedd (New York, 1875), pp. 437-38.
Angus Fletcher, Allegory: The Theory of a Symbolic Mode (Ithaca, 1964), p. 16; hereafter cited in text as A
Coleridge The Divine Comedy
Miscellaneous Criticism, ed. T. M. Raysor [London, 1936], p. 151; cited in Angus Fletcher, Allegory, p. 10
Renè Wellek, A History of Modern Criticism (New Haven, 1955) I, p. 200
Edward Honig, Dark Conceit: The Making of Allegory (Evanston, 1959), pp. 39-50
Charles Feidelson, Jr., Symbolism and American Literature (Chicago, 1953).
Michael Davitt Bell, The Development of American Romance: The Sacrifice of Relation (Chicago, 1980)

Maureen Quilligan, The Language of Allegory: Defining the Genre (Ithaca, 1979), p. 278; hereafter cited in text as LA.
Paul de Man, "The Rhetoric of Temporality," in his Blindness and Insight: Essays in the Rhetoric of Contemporary Criticism (New York, 1971), p. 191; hereafter cited in text as BI.
Gordon Teskey, "Allegory," in The Spencer Encyclopedia, ed. A. C. Hamilton (Toronto, 1990), p. 18.
Humphrey Carpenter, Tolkien: A Biography [Boston, 1977], pp. 189-90
Jean Laplanche and J.-B. Pontalis, The Language of Psycho-analysis, tr. Donald Nicholson-Smith (London, 1973), pp. 292-93.
Fredric Jameson, The Political Unconscious: Narrative as a Socially Symbolic Act (Ithaca, 1981), p. 17; hereafter cited in text as PU.
Gilles Delueze and Felix Guattari in their Anti-Oedipus (tr. Robert Hurley, Mark Seem, and Halen R. Lane [Minneapolis, 1992])

Fredric Jameson, The Political Unconscious, p. 20.
Wilhelm Reich, Sex-pol: Essays, 1929-1934, ed. Lee Baxandall, tr. Anna Bostock, Tom DuBose, and Lee Baxandall (New York, 1972).
Civilization and its Discontents (tr. James Strachey [New York, 1989]
Henri de Lubac, Exégèse Médiéval: Les Quatres Sens de l'Ecriture, 4 vols., (Paris, 1959-1964)
A. C. Charity, Events and their Afterlife: The Dialectics of Christian Typology in the Bible and Dante, (Cambridge, 1966), pp. 171-78; hereafter cited in text as EA

The Marx-Engels Reader, ed. Robert C. Tucker [New York, 1978], p. 535

Jean Daniélou, From Shadows to Reality: Studies in the Biblical Typology of the Fathers, tr. Wulstan Hibberd (Westminster, Md., 1960), p. 287.
Northrop Frye, "Theory of Symbols," in his Anatomy of Criticism (Princeton, 1957), pp. 77, 78; hereafter cited in text as AC
Fredric Jameson, The Political Unconscious, p. 71

Gérard Genette, Narrative Discourse: An Essay in Method, tr. Jane E. Lewin (Ithaca, 1980).
